channel.title: Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain?
channel.description:
My system has the following specifications
QT Wallet, Client Wallet (and version) or Web wallet: BitBay version v2.1.1.0-g32a928e Operating System and version: Windows 10
If desktop wallet (Qt or Client) block # of your client and # of connections:
Status: 7397 confirmations, broadcast through 3 nodes Date: 15-Apr-20 12:42 To: LATOKEN B4aZYR1JCHSejgFhPc61JWzfPw1Eq8aKqV Debit: -5,000.00 BAY Transaction fee: -0.0001 BAY Net amount: -5,000.0001 BAY Transaction ID: f1ae18ddd1f1b8b65c0637804e3e97f11c4cc7e15fb543e7e933cfa0e9ca5439
The problem I am having is that I sent 5000 BAY to LATOKEN (B4aZYR1JCHSejgFhPc61JWzfPw1Eq8aKqV) and they have said that the txhash cannot be found in the explorer:
https://chainz.cryptoid.info/bay/search.dws?q=f1ae18ddd1f1b8b65c0637804e3e97f11c4cc7e15fb543e7e933cfa0e9ca5439
They also asked:
"Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain? It is not detected on LATOKEN side either. Could you please check on which block is your transaction, and see with BAY team why this transaction is not visible in the explorer (which is up to date it would seem)?"
Please advise?

item.title: Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain?
item.dc:creator: @Craig_Claussen
item.description:
@Craig_Claussen wrote:

Yes. It’s an old message that was broadcast on the new wallets to let people know the peg fork was coming. It will clear with time.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain?
item.dc:creator: @tradersnow
item.description:
@tradersnow wrote:

Here is a tutorial on how to update your wallet to the latest version as well:

How to update the Client and/or QT wallet to the latest version Get Started Guides
How to update the Client and/or QT wallet to the latest version ***Note: All download links on the BitBay site point to the latest version How to update the BitBay QT Wallet: Find the download link for your platform here: https://bitbay.market/downloads Backup your wallet before doing anything! Once the update has been downloaded and installed, simply replace the previous QT wallet file with the new one. That’s it! You are now running the latest version, which has Dynamic Peg voting capab…

Read full topic
item.source: Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain?

item.title: Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain?
item.dc:creator: @Craig_Claussen
item.description:
@Craig_Claussen wrote:

pranilb:

v2.1.1.0-g32a928e

That is an old version of the QT wallet

First you need to back up your wallet.dat file.
Then you need to download the latest version from the website download page.
Then you need to clear every file except your wallet.dat file from your C:/username/appdata/roaming/bitbay folder
You can also download bootstrap file to speed up the synchronization process
If you decide to download it, you need to place the bootstrap.dat file into the same folder above.

That would mean you would only have 2 files in that folder: wallet.dat and bootstrap.dat
Then restart the QT wallet

Read full topic
item.source: Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain?

My system has the following specifications

QT Wallet, Client Wallet (and version) or Web wallet: BitBay version v2.1.1.0-g32a928e
Operating System and version: Windows 10

If desktop wallet (Qt or Client) block # of your client and # of connections:

Net amount: -5,000.0001 BAY
Transaction ID: f1ae18ddd1f1b8b65c0637804e3e97f11c4cc7e15fb543e7e933cfa0e9ca5439

The problem I am having is that I sent 5000 BAY to LATOKEN (B4aZYR1JCHSejgFhPc61JWzfPw1Eq8aKqV) and they have said that the txhash cannot be found in the explorer:

https://chainz.cryptoid.info/bay/search.dws?q=f1ae18ddd1f1b8b65c0637804e3e97f11c4cc7e15fb543e7e933cfa0e9ca5439

They also asked:

“Are you sure you sent it on the correct side of the chain?
It is not detected on LATOKEN side either.
Could you please check on which block is your transaction, and see with BAY team why this transaction is not visible in the explorer (which is up to date it would seem)?”

Please advise?
